doc.after: At 53Â°34â²39â³N 2Â°5â²32â³Wï»¿ / ï»¿53.57750Â°N 2.09222Â°Wï»¿ / 53.57750; -2.09222 (53.5777Â°, -2.0928Â°) Shaw and Crompton lies along the eastern edge of the ancient Lancashire border; Saddleworth and the Pennines are close to the east. The larger towns of Rochdale and Oldham lie to the northwest and south respectively; Royton is 1.2 miles (1.9Â km) west-southwest. There are no motorways in Shaw and Crompton, though a light rail line bisects the town from north to south.[73] The town has a post office under the Oldham post town. The territory of the civil parish is given as 4.5 square miles (11.7Â km2). For purposes of the Office for National Statistics, Shaw and Crompton forms part of the Greater Manchester Urban Area,[74] with Manchester city centre itself 8.7 miles (14.0Â km) southwest of Shaw and Crompton.
